org.apache.flink.streaming.api.windowing.policy

Class CountTriggerPolicy<IN>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.flink.streaming.api.windowing.policy.CountTriggerPolicy<IN>
  • Type Parameters:
    IN - The type of the data points which are handled by this policy
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Cloneable, CloneableTriggerPolicy<IN>, TriggerPolicy<IN>

    public class CountTriggerPolicy<IN>
extends Object
implements CloneableTriggerPolicy<IN>
    This policy triggers at every n'th element.
    See Also:

    • Constructor Detail

      • CountTriggerPolicy

        public CountTriggerPolicy(int max)
        This constructor will set up a count based trigger, which triggers after max elements have arrived.
        Parameters:
        max - The number of arriving elements before the trigger occurs.

      • CountTriggerPolicy

        public CountTriggerPolicy(int max,
                  int startValue)
        In addition to CountTriggerPolicy(int) this constructor allows to set a custom start value for the element counter. This can be used to delay the first trigger by setting a negative start value. Often the first trigger should be delayed in case of sliding windows. For example if the size of a window should be 4 and a trigger should happen every 2, a start value of -2 would allow to also have the first window of size 4.
        Parameters:
        max - The number of arriving elements before the trigger occurs.
        startValue - The start value for the counter of arriving elements.
        See Also:
        CountTriggerPolicy(int)

    • Method Detail

      • notifyTrigger

        public boolean notifyTrigger(IN datapoint)
        Description copied from interface: TriggerPolicy
        Proves and returns if a new window should be started. In case the trigger occurs (return value true) the UDF will be executed on the current element buffer without the last added element which is provided as parameter. This element will be added to the buffer after the execution of the UDF. There are possibly different strategies for eviction and triggering: 1) including last data point: Better/faster for count eviction 2) excluding last data point: Essentially required for time based eviction and delta rules As 2) is required for some policies and the benefit of using 1) is small for the others, policies are implemented according to 2).
        Specified by:
        notifyTrigger in interface TriggerPolicy<IN>
        Parameters:
        datapoint - the data point which arrived
        Returns:
        true if the current windows should be closed, otherwise false. In true case the given data point will be part of the next window and will not be included in the current one.
